definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
sheet/piece of writing/bound set of bamboo slips used for record keeping (old)/classifier for written items: chapter, article
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)

sentences.english: This is one of the best novellas I've read in a long time.
sentences.chinese: 这是我长期以来读过的最优秀的中篇小说之一。

sentences.english: Modem novelettes have experieced some ups and downs in their adaption into movies.
sentences.chinese: 当代中篇小说和电影改编之间的历史关系几历浮沉。

sentences.english: At the bottom is "A Novella by Francis Hamit".
sentences.chinese: 在底部是“弗朗西斯哈米德阿尔一个中篇小说”。

sentences.english: Medium-length novel the third day 4 look at the moon "was awarded the second prize of Lao she."
sentences.chinese: 中篇小说《初三初四看月亮》获第二届老舍文学奖。

sentences.english: Martin says it's a novella , but either way it should be interesting.
sentences.chinese: 马丁称这是一部相当有可读性的中篇小说。

sentences.english: British novelist Graham Greene was quite good at writing middle-sized fictions and won the prestige in the world.
sentences.chinese: 英国小说家格林的中篇小说构思精妙，享有世界声誉。

sentences.english: Written novella "The Old Man and the Sea".
sentences.chinese: 代表作中篇小说《老人与海》。

definition: Mao Dun Literature Prize, PRC prize for novel writing, awarded since 1982
The Sun Shines over the Sanggan River, proletarian novel by Ding Ling, winner of 1951 Stalin prize
pinyin: Tai4 yang2 Zhao4 Zai4 Sang1 gan1 He2 Shang4
